entry.title: Windows High Contrast Mode, Forced Colors Mode And CSS Custom Properties

With this setup, you will be able to release multiple times per hour with a fully documented trace managed by Git.

entry.title: A Complete Guide To Mobile App Marketing
entry.summary: Standing out among the millions of mobile apps can be challenging, but proper marketing can give you that crucial edge. This piece shares how to start your mobile app marketing strategy and improve it as you go while keeping up with the latest trends in the market.

entry.title: An Introduction To AWS Cloud Development Kit (CDK)
entry.summary: In this article, Vivek Maskara introduces Amazon Web Services‚Äô (AWS) Cloud Development Kit (CDK) which is increasingly becoming a popular tool for managing AWS-based infrastructure. We‚Äôll take a closer look into CDK concepts, and then how to use the AWS CDK toolkit to deploy a sample application to an AWS account.

entry.title: A Guide To Audio Visualization With JavaScript And GSAP (Part 2)
entry.summary: What started as a case study turned into a guide to visualizing audio with JavaScript. Although the output demos are in React, Jhey Tompkins isn‚Äôt going to dwell on the React side of things too much. The underlying techniques work with or without React.

entry.title: Performance Signals For Customizing Website UX
entry.summary: Using signals to deliver less, or different, content is a form of progressive enhancement (or graceful degradation depending on how you look at it), whereby extraneous content is only loaded when necessary, but the core functionality of the website still works. In this article, we‚Äôll look at some of the signals that can be used for this.

entry.title: How To Create An Information Architecture That Is Easy To Use
entry.summary: If users cannot find the answers to their questions or are not exposed to critical messaging, they will not act, and your website will fail. To prevent that from happening, you need an effective information architecture. In this article, Paul Boag provides you with a process to ensure you have precisely that.

entry.title: Building Web Layouts For Dual-Screen And Foldable Devices
entry.summary: Dual-screen devices are just the next evolution in responsive design. If you have a PWA or website, the APIs available make integrating into your existing code base seamless. This article explains why it‚Äôs an exciting time for layout on the web, and how dual screens provide an opportunity to get even more creative.

entry.title: New CSS Features In 2022
entry.summary: 2022 is shaping up to be a pretty great year for CSS, with a plethora of new features on the horizon. Some are already starting to land in browsers, others are likely to gain widespread browser support in 2022, while for one or two the process may be a little longer. In this article we‚Äôll take a look at a few of them.
